result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin M Anderson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: See minutes from sentencing on 2014CF138 - court orders the cash bond be applied to the restitution, fines and costs.

No Contact provision of bond has been cancelled.
43

2:10 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Kristina Sanders-Brown.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Sanders-Brown, defendant will plea to count 1 in 2014CF115, count 1 in 2015CF31 and count 1 in 2014CF138 and the balance of the counts/cases will be dismissed and read-in, with the State requesting a pre-sentence investigation report.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 of 2014CF115, count 1 on 2015CF31 and count 1 on 2014CF138.  Court strikes the place enhancer on count 1 of 2014CF115 and orders the balance of the counts/cases be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Court orders a Presentence investigation report be completed and filed with the court in 60 days.  Court sets for Sentencing on October 12, 2015 ar 8:30 a.m. Statement by DA Christenson - requests the defendant be remanded to the custody of the Green Lake County Jail.  Court revokes bond and remands the defendant to the custody of the Green Lake County Sheriff's Dept.

Court adjourned at 2:21 p.m.

10:02 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Kristina Sanders-Brown present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Kristina Sanders-Brown - in regards to 15CF43 & 15CF54, defendant will be waiving the prelims on those cases and has requested a global resolution all cases including a Marquette County case.  Court will schedule all cases for Plea & Sentencing on July 21, 2015 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:04 a.m.
from Atty Kristina Sanders-Brown - requests to appear via telephone (FAX COPY)

9:11 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Kristina Sanders-Brown via telephone.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Kristina Sanders-Brown, was just appointed on the last case 2015CF54 and requests another status hearing.  Statement by the Court - a prelim has not been held on 2015CF43 & 54.  Court will set for status hearing on June 1, 2015 at 9:30 a.m .

Court adjourned at 9:13 a.m.
from Atty Kristina Sanders-Brown dated April 21, 2015 - requests this matter be rescheduled due to a conflict

NO Contact with Officer Prachel or any members of his family.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  NO Contact with Officer Prachel or any members of his family.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

1:39 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Kristina Sanders-Brown.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  No objection to hold a courtesy appearance.  No objection by defendant.  Atty Kristina Sanders-Brown confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs regarding DNA and expungement.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $1,000.00 cash bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  NO Contact with Officer Prachel or any members of his family.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits. 

Atty Sanders-Brown requests all cases be set for status hearing.  Court sets all cases for status hearing on May 11, 2015 at 3:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:45 p.m.
